intro: Decaspermum prunoides, commonly known as the African violets, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a velvety texture. Decaspermum prunoides is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
